channel.title: Good News Network
channel.description: A Daily Dose of Positive News to Enthuse

item.title: Americans Can Donate AC Units to Seniors Who Can’t Afford Repairs
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Instead of roasting in the oppressive heat of a Mississippi summer, an 81-year-old woman is breathing easier thanks to a donated air conditioner. It’s more than just a cool thing to do. Donating an air conditioner, new or used, can save someone’s life. John Armstrong of the Harrison County Senior Resource

The post Americans Can Donate AC Units to Seniors Who Can’t Afford Repairs appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Stranger Pays Parking Ticket for Mother Staying with Baby at Hospital
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
The last thing an Australian woman needed after spending days in the hospital with her sick, infant son was a parking ticket. Fortunately, a stranger felt the same way. When the mother returned to her car—after days of sitting up with her nine-week-old son in the hospital—she found a note

The post Stranger Pays Parking Ticket for Mother Staying with Baby at Hospital appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 6-yo Boy Who Lost Both Parents Has New Purpose: Making Strangers Smile (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Jaden Hayes lost his father when he was only four, and his mother earlier this year. But the six-year-old is tired of being sad—and seeing everyone sad all the time–so he is cheering up strangers in his hometown. The adorably outspoken child asked his new guardian, Aunt Barbara, to help him

The post 6-yo Boy Who Lost Both Parents Has New Purpose: Making Strangers Smile (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: It’s Unanimous: Every Country in the UN Signs Agreement to Protect Wildlife
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
In an international body where it seems no one gets along, the United Nations has found something everyone likes – wild animals. It took three-years, but all 193 member countries of the U.N. have signed on to a resolution to create new and stronger protections for the world’s wildlife. Baby

The post It’s Unanimous: Every Country in the UN Signs Agreement to Protect Wildlife appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Precious “Lost” Tolkien Story to be Published For the First Time
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
“Not all those who wander are lost” — and not all lost manuscripts stay that way. Fans of “The Hobbit” and “Lord of the Rings” have a new book to look forward to — one that J.R.R. Tolkien wrote more than 100 years ago. It was his first fantasy work

The post Precious “Lost” Tolkien Story to be Published For the First Time appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Baby Elephant Chasing Birds is Only Video You Need on World Ele Day
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
In honor of World Elephant Day, we are trumpeting the best videos on the web showing these adorable babies using their trunks to play. No matter how many you watch, nothing beats this video (above) of a baby elephant discovering baby birds for the first time. If you want more—and how could you not—check out these

The post Baby Elephant Chasing Birds is Only Video You Need on World Ele Day appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Young Sisters Raise $650,000 Folding Origami to Build Wells Across the World
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Normally, paper and water create a soggy mess, but add origami to the mix and you get clean water flowing through the hearts of two sisters and 70 newly drilled wells in Africa, India, Mexico, Peru, and the U.S. It all started after 5-year-old Katherine Adams began folding origami with her father after they dropped off

The post Young Sisters Raise $650,000 Folding Origami to Build Wells Across the World appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 12
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
25 years ago today, the most complete and best preserved skeleton of a Tyrannosaurus rex was found in South Dakota, and named ‘Sue’, for the paleontologist, Sue Hendrickson, who made the discovery. The fossil was auctioned in 1997 for $7.6 million, the highest amount ever paid for a dinosaur fossil,

The post Good News in History, August 12 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Robin Williams’ Compassion Lives On Through Son’s Service in Prisons
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A year after Robin Williams’ death, his son Zak is carrying on the comedian’s legacy of humanitarian service. The actor’s oldest child is using his business education to teach prison inmates how to manage their finances after they’re released. Zak Williams, by his own estimate, could have coasted through life,

The post Robin Williams’ Compassion Lives On Through Son’s Service in Prisons appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: California Restores Voting Rights for 60,000 Former Felons
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A court settlement has just given 60,000 felony offenders the right to vote again in California. They all committed low-level offenses and were released, placed under community supervision to ease prison overcrowding. They never regained their right to vote and a lawsuit was filed on their behalf to get those

The post California Restores Voting Rights for 60,000 Former Felons appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Stranger Pays Unpaid Court Fines to Break Cycle of Jail for Ex-Con
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A good Samaritan has volunteered to pay off a former convict’s debt to the court — long after the man had finished paying his debt to society. Shaunte “Tay” Rowe had been struggling for 11 years to pay off $4,700 in court fees and restitution in Spokane, Washington. After reading a news

The post Stranger Pays Unpaid Court Fines to Break Cycle of Jail for Ex-Con appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Anonymous Love Letters Lift the Spirits of Anyone Signed Up on Website
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
You know that little lift you feel when you open your mailbox and find a personal letter among the bills and junk mail? Imagine finding not one cheerful note, but dozens of anonymous, hand-written envelopes filled with words of encouragement. Such joy was the vision of Hannah Brencher, who started

The post Anonymous Love Letters Lift the Spirits of Anyone Signed Up on Website appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Mom Starts Dog Treat Biz So Special Needs Adults Can Bake for Bucks
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
The chefs at this local Greensboro, North Carolina kitchen only work with a few ingredients: peanut butter, oats, oil, flour…and, of course, love. Pat Clapp started ArcBARKS Dog Treat Company as a way to help her son, David, and other special needs adults find a fulfilling way to spend their time. David

The post Mom Starts Dog Treat Biz So Special Needs Adults Can Bake for Bucks appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Photographer Finds Estranged Father While Documenting Homelessness
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A photographer documenting Hawaii’s homeless stumbled upon someone she never expected to see among them — her dad. Diana Kim’s father had owned a photography studio when she was a little girl, and she grew up with a deep interest in the art form. Her parents separated when she was

The post Photographer Finds Estranged Father While Documenting Homelessness appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Son Builds A ‘Tank’ Wheelchair to Delight His WWII Veteran Dad (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
A World War II veteran who came under enemy fire by German tanks in the 1940’s now has his own tank-like transportation – his wheelchair. It had become tough for Peter Shaw to push his 96-year-old father’s wheelchair around the grounds of his Shropshire home in the UK, so he

The post Son Builds A ‘Tank’ Wheelchair to Delight His WWII Veteran Dad (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 11
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Happy Birthday to Viola Davis. She rose out of abject poverty in South Carolina to become the Tony-award winning actress who turns 50 today. Her magnificent performance in “The Help,” playing a maid in the 1960s, earned her an Academy Award nomination. (1965) MORE Good News on this Day: The Eiger in the Bernese Alps was ascended

The post Good News in History, August 11 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Bulletproof, Fireproof, Eco-friendly Homes Are Made of Plastic Bottles
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
People from Africa to Latin America are recycling bottles and using them to build fireproof, bulletproof, environmentally-friendly homes. For about a quarter the cost of a conventional home, folks can build a two-bedroom house from 14,000 recycled plastic bottles by using the technique known as “bottle walls.” Teen’s Device to Clear Plastic

The post Bulletproof, Fireproof, Eco-friendly Homes Are Made of Plastic Bottles appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 4 Year-old Advertises to be Flower Girl and Lands a Wedding at Courthouse
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A four-year-old girl made a wish and her mom devised a brilliant plan to make it come true. It would involve a fancy dress, a basket of flowers, and a sign that read: “Can I be your flower girl?” Don’t worry. Her mother didn’t suggest she stand in the streets–not this

The post 4 Year-old Advertises to be Flower Girl and Lands a Wedding at Courthouse appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Arizona City Mandates All Dogs Sold in Pet Stores Will Come From Shelters
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
For the longest time, rescue groups, shelter volunteers, and animal lovers everywhere have hoped the day would come when pet stores would sell shelter pups exclusively, as a way to cut the profit from “puppy mills”. Last week a federal judge in Phoenix, Arizona upheld a city law requiring that

The post Arizona City Mandates All Dogs Sold in Pet Stores Will Come From Shelters appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Elderly Man’s Home is Repainted by Strangers After Kids Make Fun Of It
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Leonard Bullock is one of those guys who sits on his porch every day. And a railroad track inspector named Josh Cyganik has made it a point to wave to the 75-year-old every day for four years. Josh and his fellow workers begin every day in the railroad yard across the street from Leonard’s

The post Elderly Man’s Home is Repainted by Strangers After Kids Make Fun Of It appeared first on Good News Network.
